intro: Ilex matangicola, commonly known as the Matangicola holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny leaves and small, dark berries. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. It has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 6 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
